intro: Colleteria seminervis, commonly known as the slender-leaved colleteria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Colleteria seminervis is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
